name: Universal Studios Singapore

reviews.title: A magic place
reviews.text: One of my dream bucket list. I’ve been wanting to come here since I was young, but somehow managed to be here when I’m older. This place is magical and always makes me feel young!

reviews.title: Ride the Cylone Rollercoaster,  the wait is worth it.
reviews.text: When we were there it wasn't that busy.  Although we opted for the Express pass some rides only had a 10 min waiting time.  Get there when it opens to avoid the crowds. It's  smaller than Japan and California,  but still worthwhile.  Best roller-coaster  - Cylone.

reviews.title: Great Day Out
reviews.text: Was exceptionally clean and staff exceptionally hospitable, not large but can do comfortably in a full day.unfortunately several rides closed due to inclement weather

reviews.title: Best family day
reviews.text: USS is the best theme park to visit, the newly opened minionland was also so much fun. My kids were the most excited ones!!

reviews.title: Good
reviews.text: The place is full of great entertainment and fun, The express ticket as they say allows you to access everything without waiting in a queue but that is not true, the staff member outside informed us that there is two types of express ticket, one with exeption for some games where you have to wait in a ling queue and another express when you pay higher price so you access everything without waiting, then when we got inside that was not correct as in some games we were told that we cant use express ticket, and if you will go to repeat one game that you like then you cannot use the express ticket, it's only one time use,  also we had to pay for the dryer after we got wet with water spalsh game, so what's the use of paying extra for express ticket. Many people from different countries are visiting the place there should be a variety of global fast food restaurant, but there is not, also the drinks should be better and have vriety but all the of them sell the same juice every where there. Also one show at water world i missed it some years ago as the last show was at 3 pm, and last week this side was closed for maintenance which was disappointing. They need to have more seating areas with air condition so people can rest in between as the weather is so hot. The experience was overall good but a lot of dissappointments here and there.

description: Singapore’s only movie-theme park features 24 rides and attractions, including a pair of dueling coasters that brush past one another in several near misses in their aerial combat. Thrill-seekers can choose between a coaster where they are seated or the other where riders are suspended. Exciting loops, sudden turns, breathtaking drops and thrilling near-collisions will make you scream your heart out. Dinosaurs, lemurs, ogres and Egyptian mummies add to the thrills and adventures.With 18 attractions created or redesigned for Singapore, Universal Studios Singapore™ promises an experience that you will not forget. Laughter and screams are heard around every corner, and lasting memories are made every day. Themed dining and shops are available. UNIVERSAL STUDIOS, UNIVERSAL STUDIOS SINGAPORE, Universal Globe logo, and all Universal elements and related indicia ™ & © Universal Studios. All Rights Reserved.

address.address_string: 8 Sentosa Gateway Resorts World Sentosa, Sentosa Island 098269 Singapore

name: Singapore Flyer

reviews.title: Recommend going at twilight for day and night views
reviews.text: The views from the top-most point are really good. Would recommend going there at twilight so that you can see views of both day and night as the lights come on. The F1 track can also be seen clearly, especially the main straight.

reviews.title: Good
reviews.text:
Good place to view city from top. It wasn't crowdy, so no long waiting time. Anoying that before actual ride you must go through "mandatory" time-capsule exbition halls.
Overall - recommend as one of must-do in city.

reviews.title: Great views over the city
reviews.text: Though quite pricey for the 40 minute circuit, the views from the top are worth it. I did not like the obligatory "Time Capsule" passage we had to go through to get to the actual ride!  We arrived on a cloudy afternoon and there was no line, no wait and we had the capsule to ourselves, which was lots of fun!

reviews.title: The interactive bit was a let down
reviews.text: The interactive bit to start was a let down, but to be fair we only wanted to go on the big wheel! Great views of Singapore, wouldn’t go back, but I suppose worth it for seeing the sights.

reviews.title: Singapore Flyer is highly recommended
reviews.text:
Highly recommend the basic ride on the flyer @ $40. For 30 minutes you have uninterrupted bird’s eye views of the landscape and iconic attractions of Singapore.

Higher priced options available from
rides with Moet Champagne or Singapore Sling Cocktails, up-to dinner for two at $520 per couple.

There is also a great little interactive history of Singapore walk through prior to boarding included in the $40 ticket. Well worth including in your Singapore itinerary.

description: At 165 metres tall, Singapore Flyer is a masterpiece of urban architecture and engineering that showcases not only the mesmerizing cosmopolitan cityscape of the tropical Lion City, but even the surrounding islands of Indonesia and parts of Malaysia in all their glory. In addition to offering panoramic views of Singapore's cosmopolitan cityscape, guests can also indulge in a flute of champagne, or savour the iconic Singapore Sling whilst hosted in a special themed capsule. Diners seeking both privacy and luxury can opt for a multi-sensory treat unlike any other with our Premium Sky Dining Flight, complete with a four-course dinner and an in-flight host.

address_obj.address_string: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803 Singapore

name: Singapore Zoo

reviews.title: Breakfast at the Zoo
reviews.text: loved the whole experience of Breakfast At The Zoo.  The younger family members were able to interact with several animals. The meal was great and we saw the Sealion Show afterwards.  Unfortunately it was too humid to spend much more time there, but still very worthwhile.

reviews.title: Visions of the future that come from an understanding of the past and the inter-connectivity of life on Earth.
reviews.text:
Review of Singapore Zoo

This was our second visit to Singapore Zoo in two years and we remain as committed to our earlier findings as those of the current day …. The zoo provides an excellent opportunity to catch a glimpse of the complexity of the natural world that surrounds us. Besides looking at the animals in their protective enclosures there’s the underlying messages for conservation, value and appreciation that an entertaining day at the zoo provides. It helps to emphasize the unnatural balance of people worldwide within the demand for resources of land, materials, food, water and living space … with much the same requirements for the other creatures with which we share the planet.

The messages are there for those who seek them except it’s a lot to ask when you’ve a day out with the kids/family and you’re enjoying the pleasures of seeing these animals, bird, etc. in as natural an environment that the zoo can provide in the estimated 28 ha available. Here it is that you’ve an opportunity of educating/introducing those same kids to those same responsibilities that you’ve had for much of your life …. leaving space for the other species. The challenges of doing this with a global population of 8B that is expected to peak at 10B by the second half of the 21st C. remains for future generations (including those kids with you and their descendants). The zoo handles these messages well.

Whilst the traditional animal enclosures – looking, at times, rather dated and tired – provide the basis of the day’s exploration, there may also have been a lean towards entertainment of a Disneyesque kind during the time since we were last there. We watched the kids being kangaroos on a timed ‘leaping pad’ (measuring leaps/distance/time), other kids running up/down a couple of boards with foot holds across them – again, against the clock (4 secs being the fastest) and still other kids testing their personal strength by lifting buckets on pulleys with different loadings. We don’t remember those features from earlier. 

The food centres – zoo entrance, tram terminal and KFC-centre – remain as popular as ever. Larger? More investment? Who knows? Sure, people expect to find facilities of this kind. Have there been similar animal-focussed investment in the modern era? There seems to have been more focus upon entertainment activities associated with ‘wild animals’ including night life, river ventures and bird life rides/worlds. In the pipeline is a rainforest world. Where does the traditional scientific appreciation of ‘wildlife’ become absorbed into ‘managed wildlife’ because that may be the likely future for the original indigenous fauna (and flora) everywhere. The Wild Africa section of the zoo is a case in point. All wildlife in Africa is currently at risk of becoming lost as a result of expanding human populations, poverty, insufficient investment and mixed priorities on the part of national governments. The traditional images of Africa remain a reality of earlier times. Wildlife is in decline everywhere on the continent. Singapore zoo and others with a similar vision focus upon domestic breeding programs and the re-introduction/management of species in the wild – white rhino and Rothschild giraffe are two examples of where the zoo has been successful.

More’s the pity that, as a species, we have been so careless, lacking in understanding and appreciation of the animals, birds, insects, plants and other lifeforms around us and upon which we remain dependent. Messages such as this are found throughout the Zoo when describing the animals that are available, the loss of habitat (and particularly in regional Asia) where, in recent times, plantation agriculture has been replacing the original forests that once provided home and sustenance for animals in the Zoo – orangutans, gharials, tigers, Asian rhinos, Asian hippopotamus and others. There’s a pertinent and really sad message of this kind in the Tiger compound describing the demise of the tiger across Asia – just two native homes remain from the entire Asian continent because of persecution/hunting from the 1970s-on. Once found from the Caspian Sea to Eastern China, indigenous tigers can now only be found in India and Malaysia. There are estimated <3,000 tigers in the wild and - all this - has happened during my lifetime.

So, some serious messages for the future of the species on show at Singapore Zoo, but also some emphasis on the value of national investments of this kind as part of educating everyone (starting with the kids) that they/we are simply one of many species within the fabric of Life on Earth that helps to sustain us. Respect, understanding, science, knowledge and education underly the entertainment value of the Zoo.

If you live in Singapore, ensure that you support this national icon with an occasional visit. If you’re travelling through, here’s an expensive but highly recommended day that will provide a reasonable/confidential/self-assured vision that people of the future may be able to live in an urban/built environment that has come to terms with a sustainable world – for all species.

Peter Steele
21 June 2024

reviews.title: One of the world’s best zoos
reviews.text: Very well maintained with a large number of animals. The elephants and the giraffes were the show stoppers for my kid. They have a decent number of snack zones sprinkled throughout the park. Would highly recommend to make use of the zoo train that they have to get around.

reviews.title: Ethical zoo with free reigning animals. Amazing day out.
reviews.text: Had an amazing day at the zoo. We are not massive zoo people as they can often be quite sad for the animals but this place felt ethical. The animals had free rein of the park and we didn’t see a single cage the whole time we were there. The monkeys and orangutans have their own sky garden. We were take aback by the animals in the fragile forests and the fact you could walk amongst them. The 2 shows were really fun and entertaining. If you have any doubts about this place I would leave them at home and try for yourself.

reviews.title: Most beautiful zoo of the world
reviews.text: What a beautiful zoo with plenty of space and activities for the animals. We were particularly impressed by the presentation of the animals and the opulent tropical plants and flowers.

description: Set in a rainforest environment, Singapore Zoo is home to over 2,800 animals from over 300 species of mammals, birds and reptiles. The park also boasts the world's first free-ranging orang utan habitat in a zoo. Delight in an exciting outdoor feast at Jungle Breakfast with Wildlife, an internationally acclaimed, award-winning programme that offers exhilarating experience with orangutans. The fun is endless with interesting animal presentations, photography with animals and more!

address_obj.address_string: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826 Singapore

ranking_data.ranking_string: #8 of 1,250 things to do in Singapore

address.address_string: 80 Mandai Lake Road, Singapore 729826 Singapore

name: Singapore Botanic Gardens

reviews.title: Beautiful Day Out
reviews.text: Beautiful gardens with separate orchid house, I visited the Botanical Gardens as part of a City tour, we only had about 90 minutes, you definitely need most of a day to really enjoy the experience

reviews.title: If only...........
reviews.text:
Never to be missed, we spent two mornings at the Botanic Gardens, both times arriving just as dawn was breaking courtesy of the MRT.  This allowed a full morning to be spent around the gardens, taking in breakfast after a couple of hours and retiring back to our son’s apartment around lunchtime when it became too hot and humid.

So much has been written about the gardens, there is no real need to add more except to confirm that they are world class, beautifully maintained by a veritable army of gardeners and, amazingly, apart from the orchid garden, free of charge.  They are a favourite with joggers, dog walkers and, as the morning wears on, organised school visits and crocodiles of tourists.  Busy, but never crowded.

There is always a lot of wildlife around but on our first visit, we did not see Singapore’s famous film-star otters.  There was lots of advice from people about where they were yesterday, or their usual routes between ponds, and there were  birds, terrapins and salamanders a-plenty; but no otters.  Maybe, being film stars, their agent only lets them come out for appearance money these days.

The second visit also started early and my wife decided that it was necessary to “discuss” which platform to use at Downtown MRT station to get to the gardens.  (Same as on the previous occasion, one might have thought.)  Naturally, she favoured the “other” one.  By the time the discussion was over, we descended to the platform to see the train vanishing down the tunnel.  No matter, it was only two minutes until the next one.  

However, they were an important two minutes.  We strolled into the gardens accompanying the usual joggers and dog walkers who take advantage of the cool dawn period, and as we rounded the corner towards the northernmost pond, we were just in time to see the back legs and tail of an otter slip into the water fifty yards away.  By the time we made that spot, the only trace of otters were about half a dozen tiny bow waves at the other side of the pond heading for the reeds.  If only we had not been held up by the “discussion” and missed the train!  Oh well; next time we are in Singapore perhaps.

Anyway, it was still a most pleasing morning around the gardens and they remain, even with elusive otters, a “must see” location in Singapore.

reviews.title: Lovely way to spend day in gardens
reviews.text:
We had a great day at the gardens.  They are great to see and lots of different plants and trees and lovely views.

It did start raining heavily when we were there but they do have shelters dotted around the gardens to shelter in but recommend taking your umbrella.

We particularly enjoyed the food at the food hall - it was v quiet when we were there but of really good standard.

reviews.title: Blooming with wildlife
reviews.text: My family and I enjoyed a peaceful walk around the Botanical gardens of Singapore. During our pleasant stroll we saw a monitor lizard, a terrapin and many other amazing creatures. I guarantee that you will see some amazing wildlife and enjoy your walk.

reviews.title: Yes- It Really Is a Must See
reviews.text: Yes- it’s beautiful- the year round growing season makes it possible to walk around a blooming jungle. The orchid area was too crowded and hot for me- the gardens are extensive and well maintained but it’s a lengthy walk- mostly level with relatively frequent seating areas . No internal transportation- occasional birds and animals. There’s a Hop on Bus stop near the orchid area.

description: This national park is open daily and features beautiful lakes, animals, flowers and plants, including one of the region's first rubber tree orchards.

name: Singapore Discovery Centre

reviews.title: First travel  To Singapore country
reviews.text: Good country for tourish clean good walking distance publik Transport with. Another area i easy and good for money also

reviews.title: Great learning journey about Singapore!
reviews.text: Excellent commentary by Gabriel. Keep up the great job! Good coverage of contents and good timing. Truly enjoy the informative programme.

reviews.title: Tour
reviews.text: The tour is informative and cool, the tour guide Jerry knows her content very well and engages the audience quite well, will go again

reviews.title: SDC tour.
reviews.text: the tour guide at SDC was very knowledgeable on the subject as well as clear in her delivery of speech. This was a fruitful experience and I would go again.

reviews.title: SAFTI MI bus tour
reviews.text: Very informative bus tour with tour guide Alya. Saw several of the buildings as well as the sports training facilities from the bus. (30 - 40 minutes). The tour was free.

description: Hear the past, touch the present and see the future at Singapore Discovery Centre. Be inspired! Through our fun and interactive galleries and attractions, visitors enjoy a multi-sensory learning experience while gaining insights into Singapore’s dreams, aspirations and challenges.

address_obj.address_string: 510 Upper Jurong Road SAFTI Military Institute, Singapore 638365 Singapore

ranking_data.ranking_string: #14 of 1,250 things to do in Singapore

address.address_string: 510 Upper Jurong Road SAFTI Military Institute, Singapore 638365 Singapore

name: Singapore Cable Car

reviews.title: Not worth the money.
reviews.text: We took the cable car as a family of 3 and the cost seriously outweighs the highlights.  Mount Faber Peak is just cafes and a gift shop, and the 10 minute walk to Mount Faber Peal Park leads to quite disappointing views.  Don't waste your money.

reviews.title: No powerchair access
reviews.text: They will not let any power or electric wheelchair on at all. Not even if you transfer. Very disappointing . Manual wheelchair users and prams are ok but powerchairs have to go via tram

reviews.title: It's pretty cool
reviews.text: I rode the cable car just for fun up to Mount Faber, over to Sentosa, then back to the mainland. I didn't see much of anything on Sentosa that I really needed to see, but it was nice riding the cable cars. We also did the upgrade to a SkyOrb and was kind of cool.  None of them were air conditioned, so it was hot.

reviews.title: Cable car experience
reviews.text:
Nice cable car trip, but expensive for what it is. You can only ride once, not all day, as we were told.
Had some lovely views of Sentosa, the beaches and the port

reviews.title: Great way to spend some time without spending a lot of money
reviews.text:
This was a surprisingly interesting attraction. This is my third trip to Singapore but my first time here and I really enjoyed this. 

It was a lovely way to get an overview of lots of things and attractions and sights without needing to commit to any extra expenses.

A weekday morning meant it was very quiet. I imagine it can get very busy other times.

description: The breath-taking connection between Faber Peak Singapore and Sentosa Island Established since 1974, Singapore Cable Car is the nation's first and only cableway that links Faber Peak on mainland Singapore to the island resort of Sentosa, before flying you to the Merlion or the sandy beach at Siloso. Today, the cable car rides are enjoyed across a Cable Car Sky Network of more than 100 cabins spanning almost 5 kilometres on the Mount Faber Line and the Sentosa Line. A 'joyride' across the Cable Car Sky Network offers a 360-degree aerial and visual treat of the entire Sentosa-HarbourFront skyline and the resort island. The scenery transforms as the cabins soar above the forest, through a skyscraper, over the harbour and travel across the jungle, sand and sea. Our passionate service ambassadors are on hand to create happy moments for all cable car joyriders. Singapore Cable Car Opening Hours: From 8.45am to 10pm (Last boarding: 9.30pm)

address_obj.address_string: 109 Mount Faber Road Mount Faber Peak, Singapore 099203 Singapore

ranking_data.ranking_string: #61 of 1,250 things to do in Singapore

address.address_string: 109 Mount Faber Road Mount Faber Peak, Singapore 099203 Singapore

name: National Museum of Singapore

reviews.title: Don't miss the chicken curry :-)
reviews.text: To be honest, I was a bit miffed after buying a ticket to find that most of the museum seemed to be closed except for one permanent gallery and a temporary exhibition, but they were both excellent so it was fine. The permanent gallery is the story of Singapore from pre-history to now which is very well illustrated and laid out. The temporary exhibition was photography of the tribes of the Amazon and was superb. The real high point though was the chicken curry in the cafe which was absolutely excellent!

reviews.title: Look at local history via the eyes of locals and the Amazonas exertion
reviews.text:
It’s an interesting site for every visitor of the town.
It is not made in a very professional way, but it is interesting to view in the eyes of locals the history of Singapore 

If you have some spare time, climb up the mountain and go see the place

reviews.title: Definitely worth a visit
reviews.text: They had 2 very good exhibits; Amazon & History of Singapore. However, the museum is under renovation so they have a weird entrance, one small bathroom and not much common area to sit and relax etc

reviews.title: A Fascinating Journey Through Singapore’s History
reviews.text: A great place to learn about the country’s rich history in an engaging way. The exhibits are well-curated, with a mix of artifacts, interactive displays, and immersive storytelling. The building itself is beautiful, blending history with modern design. It’s definitely worth a visit if you enjoy culture and history!

reviews.title: A  rainy day experience
reviews.text: This is a well presented and informative museum, on the small side but well laid out. Takes you on a journey of Singapore evolution with informative text, photographs and objects. The staff were helpful a welcoming. It was easy to spend a couple of hours here, we did not visit the Amazonian exhibit.

description: With a history dating back to its inception in 1887, the National Museum of Singapore is the nation's oldest museum with a progressive mind. Its galleries adopt cutting-edge and multi-perspective ways of presenting history and culture to redefine conventional museum experience. A cultural and architectural landmark in Singapore, the Museum hosts innovative festivals and events all year round-the dynamic Night Festival, visually arresting art installations, as well as amazing performances and film screenings-in addition to presenting thought-provoking exhibitions involving critically important collections of artefacts. The programming is supported by a wide range of facilities and services including F&B, retail and a Resource Centre. The National Museum of Singapore re-opened in December 2006 after a three-year redevelopment, and celebrated its 125th anniversary in 2012. The Museum refreshed its permanent galleries and re-opened them on 19 September 2015 for Singapore's Golden Jubilee.

address_obj.street1: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore
address_obj.address_string: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897 Singapore

ranking_data.ranking_string: #35 of 1,250 things to do in Singapore

address.street1: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore
address.address_string: 93 Stamford Road National Museum of Singapore, Singapore 178897 Singapore

reviews.title: Reasonably convenient and affordable and clean transit
reviews.text: The Singapore MRT is a decently affordable and effective way to get around. Even with just using a contactless credit card, the charges accumulated were not high. Some of the stations have tons of entrances and you may have to do a bit of walking still. But the culture on the trains is quite respectful and I would definitely ride again as a tourist.

reviews.title: Don’t Bring Your Durians Aboard!
reviews.text: Singapore is fortunate to boast a state-of-the-art, frequent, well-maintained transit system. I enjoyed riding it on my short trip. Even without a nonstop connection to Changi Airport (instead having to stop at Tanah Merah), it’s super convenient.

reviews.title: Great system-Easy to use
reviews.text: Great public transit system. Easy to use and navigate. No need to rent a car at all. One tip-you still need to be able to walk distances as the connections within the stations are often far apart. Having said that however, there are few places where the MRT won’t take you.

reviews.title: Don't normally give 4* to MRT's
reviews.text:
Credit where credit is due. I don't normally give such high ratings as it's a a job normally anyone can do. 

But the four journeys I've had was pleasent and reasonable, unlike out London Underground

reviews.title: Fast and efficient
reviews.text: So easy to use. Just buy a card, put some money on it and away you go. Plenty of stations. Everything clean , modern and well maintained. Stations well sign posted so easy to work out how to get to places. Small screens and speakers on trains let you know exactly what's happening. Always felt safe and trains run every few minutes.

address_obj.address_string: Singapore Singapore

ranking_data.ranking_string: #1 of 1,250 things to do in Singapore

address.address_string: Singapore Singapore

name: Singapore River Cruise

reviews.title: Thoroughly Enjoyable!
reviews.text:
I adored this river cruise. Our family of five had the boat to ourselves except for another couple. We sat up the back (which is uncovered) and had a thoroughly enjoyable time.

We left at nightfall (dusk) and by halfway through the cruise, it was dark, and Singapore's lights revealed themselves in all their beautiful glory!

The recorded guide over the speaker was informative and not too loud or intrusive, and we all found it be very interesting and relaxing.

The 'bumboat' cruise on the river was one of the most pleasant and enjoyable moments of our 6 day stay in Singapore. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: NOT RECOMMENDED...
reviews.text: Its a rip off cruise, not worth it at all. It says 40 min but they cut the tour short and we were back in 25 min. Not recommended at all.

reviews.title: Gorgeous look at the city from the water
reviews.text: I highly recommend taking the river cruise on your first day here as it gives you a great introduction and look at Singapore. The dock and the ticket office is at the end of Clarke Quay - very easy to find on the mapping apps. The queue moves quickly as there are multiple boats in operation. You do not need to purchase tickets in advance. We arrived in the evening so that we could see the cityscape lit up, and the views were breathtaking. The cruise is roughly 45 minutes around the harbor and is accompanied with a helpful recorded narration.

reviews.title: Historic Singapore from the river
reviews.text: Travelling by bumboat provides an interesting view of some of city.  Many historic places are passed with good information provided by the recorded commentary.  We did the cruise on a rainy day and it was a good way to see the sights without getting wet.  Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Worth doing.
reviews.text: I found this very enjoyable. Its a short cruise about 40 mins but well worth it as it gives a really good view of the clarke quay and merlion park area and the view of the buildings from the water is really good. Smooth journey and even though it rained a bit  all good as there is a covered par of the ship. The clarke quay embarkation point is very near some restaurants also. Good tips and some funny banter from the guide.

description: Cruising since 1987. For more than a decade and a half, bumboats have been plying the Singapore River. The story of Singapore River Cruise begins in 1987. The "Clean Rivers Campaign" of 1983 saw the relocation of bumboats to Pasir Panjang. The familiar painted faces of our Bumboats were due to disappear from its home, until SRC was awarded the tender license to run river services here - the first also, to operate such services along the river. We are entering a new chapter in the Singapore River story. In this modern age, Bumboats on this historic waterway remind us of its rustic charm. SRC has been preserving the heritage of this important river for more than two decades. Its bumboats have become the icon of our river to visitors and locals alike. 2008 was a year when our iconic bumboats underwent a transformation. The diesel-powered engines of SRC's fleet made way for a new generation of electric ones that boast quieter engines and zero CO2 emissions. These are the very boats that operate along the Singapore River today. SRC is committed to greater excellence. Under its strong management, the company has developed a firm network of channel intermediaries from government agencies, embassies, event organizers and other operators in the tourism sector, both local and overseas. From a humble fleet of 4 bumboats in 1987, SRC has since increased its number to 24 today with a few new additions coming onboard soon.

address_obj.address_string: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay BayFront South, Singapore 179019 Singapore

ranking_data.ranking_string: #8 of 129 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Singapore

address.address_string: 3 River Valley Road Clarke Quay BayFront South, Singapore 179019 Singapore

name: Free Singapore Tour

reviews.title: Will be back
reviews.text: Guide Cheyenne was a delight- bubbly- very well versed in her knowledge of the area she was taking us to. Chinatown was very interesting with many pla es of worship and famous eateries including a great  visit to Maxwell street food market. Cheyenne took lovely group photos which were sent on afterwards along with notes from the walk with links to subjects visited. A very good tour which having done 2previous with different guide- quality and standard of guide is excellent.

reviews.title: Superb Andrew
reviews.text: Andrew on heritage tour is a very competent informed person who conducts the tour in a very professional and courteous manner…thoroughly enjoyed his commentary

reviews.title: Fantastic airport adventure
reviews.text: An unforgettable tour! Andrew made the city come alive with vivid sights and storytelling. Definitely need to return to see more!

reviews.title: Great free Heritage Tour
reviews.text: We decided to take the Heritage Tour when our New Zealand flight times were changed, and we had more time at Changi Airport.  We found the details of this FREE experience on the Changi Airport web site and booked our places as soon as the booking opened.  We would recommend booking as place on tours are limited and some on the day walk ups were turned away, as our tour was full.  It was a really GREAT experience and gave us views of Singapore, its buildings and areas, that we were then able to visit when we returned for a 4 night stopover at the end of our holiday.  The tour, in a comfortable air conditioned coach, included three stops, where everyone had to leave the coach, take their belongings and walk on the pavement to the attraction.  We only had a small amount of hand luggage and managed fine but we felt that some of the more elderly people on the tour, found this part a little challenging in the heat.  Our guide Lynda was informative and gave us good insight into Singapore and its people.  So if you fulfil the criteria for this free tour and are of reasonable fitness, we would definitely recommend taking it.

reviews.title: An excellent short tour of the highlights of Singapore
reviews.text:
The free tour is a great way to spend a couple of hours during a layover and gives you an excellent overview of Singapore so that you can plan a longer stay on future trips. We did the City Sights Tour and our guide Jamie was very knowledgeable and made it a really fun afternoon.
You can leave your bulky carry-on bags in the airport baggage storage facilities before starting the tour. It's worth noting that you can only leave laptops in the T3 baggage store, the T2 store doesn't accept them.

description: If you are transiting through this tiny island-state, you can discover Singapore’s sights and sounds, and rich heritage with the Free Singapore Tour. For travellers with at least 5.5 hours to 24 hours to spare till your connecting flight, join one of our free 2.5-hour guided tours. Availability of seats is on a first-come, first-served basis and tour itinerary may change, depending on weather and traffic conditions. Visit our website to find out more information and to register now!

reviews.title: Great lunch set!
reviews.text: Great value for the lunch set. Good variety of appetiser, mains and dessert to choose from. Friendly staff and good ambience

reviews.title: Excellent experience definitely coming back
reviews.text: Great food and very accomodating staffs. Kate and Alison are very courteous. Food are well cooked and desserts are yummy

reviews.title: Birthday Treat
reviews.text: Excellent ambience and very attentive and helpful staff.  Food was excellent and would visit again.  Tried the omakase and several other side dishes.

reviews.title: Had a great lunch at Koma
reviews.text:
Our first visit in this restaurant. We were greeted with a bright smile at the reception. The staff serving us are friendly and patient explaining the items in the menu. 
It’s a great place to dine in with friends and family, with great food and great ambience.

reviews.title: Koma is beautiful
reviews.text: Food was great the restaurant is beautiful and staff was very welcoming. I was alone and server made suggestions and i went with what he shared.

description: KOMA, an original concept from TAO Group, is a Japanese restaurant and sushi bar offering a modern interpretation of Japanese cuisine. Featuring original creations from Executive Chef Hiroshi Shimada, KOMA takes a bold and distinct approach in its menu, incorporating fresh and seasonal produce and ingredients from Japan.

name: MTR Singapore

reviews.title: As good as I remember
reviews.text:
This restaurant still serves great vegertarian food. It was a treat to return here after almost ten years.

We had the Masala Dosai, but I feel like you can't make a bad choice here. Everything looks great,

reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.text:
This is a not flash Indian vegetarian restaurant but it serves good, tasty and well cooked food. The service is prompt and the restaurant is clean.
The fact that it was packed with locals says a lot about how good it is.

reviews.title: Good restaurant
reviews.text: Tasty vegetarian food served efficiently in a hygienic setting. The restaurant has 2 sections, in the first, the customer pays for the food first and is served at the table. The staff is friendly and the menu is elaborate. Is on the main road in Little India at Singapore.

reviews.title: Nice
reviews.text: MTR Singapore provides a cozy, comfortable setting with an ambiance that reflects its South Indian roots. The interiors are simple yet inviting, with a mix of modern and traditional décor. It’s a casual space where you can easily enjoy a meal with friends or family. The restaurant is typically quite busy, which speaks to its popularity, but the service remains efficient.

reviews.title: Authentic Indian breakfast - A daily delight
reviews.text: MTR in Little India was a blessing during our short stay in Singapore. Since it was within walking distance from our hotel, we ended up going there every day for breakfast. The food was just as good as what you'd find in India. The dosas were excellent, and the other dishes like idli were equally enjoyable. The restaurant has a spacious dining area and isn't usually crowded in the mornings, unlike the afternoons. It's also easy to find, located right across from the Indian temple.

description: Serving Pure Vegetarian Authentic South Indian Food Since 1924. Only the Finest and Fresh Ingredients used. NO MSG,Chemicals and Preservatives used. . Freshly prepared food. Situated Opp. Sri Srinivasa Perumal Temple on Serangoon Road. Near Ferrer Park MRT station.. Next to City Square Mall.

address.address_string: 438 Serangoon Road Opposite Sri Srinivasa Perumal Temple, Singapore 218133 Singapore

name: CE LA VI Singapore

reviews.title: Must see overcrowded place
reviews.text: Very crowded with not enough tables and chairs for all guests. If someone is keen on the city views it is better to go on the sightseeing platform. In the rooftop bar is very crowded and if you did not reserve the sofa table you will not be able to enjoy the views properly. The min spend for sofa tables is about 2000 S$.

reviews.title: Ignore the moaners…
reviews.text: Cannot think of one thing to criticise (unlike some on here).  Pay no heed to the less than complimentary reviews, this is a must.  And good value too.

reviews.title: Gotta go for a sling
reviews.text: All part of the Marina Sands experience. You pay to go to the top but you get drinks credit back so good in that regard. DJ laying, great views over the city then it p....d down with rain for half an hour. Ah well...another drink...and the sun came out.   All in all a beaut afternoon out.

reviews.title: Not worth it!!!
reviews.text: Terrible service. Servers were okay but they were completely understaffed.  They were running around trying to help everyone buy a lot of people were still waiting and upset.  Food was just ok

reviews.title: It's not what you think it is.....
reviews.text:
We're visiting Singapore & checked in at the Marina Bay Sands Hotel so we decided to celebrate our Valentine's Day at Cé La Vi since we don't have this in Vegas. We made a reservation in advance like 3 weeks prior & booked through the Marina Bay Sands app & says there that prepaid dinner is required for $238++ per person & is none refundable. We still went ahead & booked it thinking it's once and a lifetime experience. 

It's a 6-course meal (see picture below). We got there and of course the location is breathtaking because it's on the rooftop 57th floor of the MBS hotel overlooking the city. We didn't go there for the view because we are a guest at the hotel so we have free access to the infinity pools, etc. We came to experience dining in. We had high hopes because of the price we paid. Surprisingly disappointing and underwhelming. The ambiance is very casual, thought it was a "fine dining" as described & showed in their rez website. For something that is special occasion and couples that choose to celebrate V-Day there, there's nothing special about this place, no red tablecloth with flowers on the tables. Like I said it's very basic & casual. The food is fine but it's not worth of the price we paid. Aside from that, we ordered a glass of mocato and coke zero plus the 750 ml bottle of water they provided, which they also charge $12/bottle and we drank 2 bottles, lol. So our total bill came over S$600++ (minus the prepaid dinner of $238). So it's about $300++ per person which I think is not what worthy. Would I do it again? NO....  but the service was great. 

I was told that they're planning to do a renovation of this place, I hope they will upscale it somehow. As a tourists, it's very disappointing....

description: Southeast Asia's premier rooftop dining and entertainment destination located atop the Marina Bay Sands SkyPark.

name: Paulaner Brauhaus Singapore

reviews.title: Saturday afternoon drinks, a great spot.
reviews.text: Stopped in for a drink before dinner elsewhere. Around 3pm the brewery was bustling and the ambience was welcoming. Two for one beers a highlight and the sparking rosè if you’re not a beer drinker was delicious.

reviews.title: Solid
reviews.text: Kales is solid at gettting customers on his good side. Very friendly and the beers are great. Had a great time chatting and drinking

reviews.title: Authentic German
reviews.text: Good atmosphere and good food, it was an absolutely delightful experience from start to finish! The moment I walked in, I was greeted with a warm, welcoming atmosphere that perfectly captured the charm of a traditional German Gasthaus. The decor was cozy and authentic, with wooden beams, rustic furniture, and even a few nods to Bavarian culture—it felt like a little slice of Germany right here in

reviews.title: With the quickness
reviews.text: Bartender kales is killing it. Fast great pour. Great beer brewed on site. Happy hour special buy one get one runs 24 hours and 7 days a week

reviews.title: Crispy Knuckle, Great Beer!
reviews.text: Authentic German experience! The pork knuckle was crispy and juicy, and the beer selection was top-notch. A bit pricey, but worth it for a special occasion. Service was friendly and efficient. Definitely coming back!

description: Paulaner Bräuhaus is Singapore’s first and only authentic German microbrewery. The three-storey bar and restaurant at Millenia Walk is Asia’s model flagship store with fresh new interiors and an updated food menu. Keeping to the German “Geselligkeit” (sociability) concept, the updated menu of authentic Bavarian dishes is perfect with beer and for communal dining. Customers can look forward to revelling in the convivial atmosphere and the brand’s signature hospitality.

address.address_string: 9 Raffles Boulevard #01-01 Millenia Walk, Singapore 039596 Singapore

reviews.title: UMAI! Delicious Lunch and Great Experience!
reviews.text: Umai! Really enjoyed my lunch here! I had a fantastic lunch at this Japanese restaurant. The flavors were authentic, and every dish was beautifully presented. The atmosphere is cozy, perfect for a relaxing meal.  Highly recommend this place to anyone who loves Japanese cuisine. I'll definitely be coming back for more!

reviews.title: No Frills, Straight Up Japanese Izakaya
reviews.text:
Went here with a friend during opening time and ended up to nearly closing time.  We enjoyed eating here that much.

If you are unfamiliar, this place is an izakaya.  Like a Japanese pub.  So naturally, as a patron or first-time visitor, you should be going here for the alcoholic drinks or sake offered first and then enjoy the food with it.  Don't let the reviews on the service fool you.  The service is very good and the wait staff are attentive.  The owner is as well --- make sure to treat his baby as it should be --- a proper izakaya.

The food selection is great and can be varied depending on the day.  Always ask for what is in season or what is the special.  We ordered a lot from sushi and sashimi and the usual tempura to the different warming soups.  The Maguro Kakuni was excellent.  The Buri-Jiru was an experience on the taste buds.  The menu though is subject to change with the season so make sure to visit during different periods to fully enjoy the varied offerings.

The sake selection is very respectable.  Several options range from affordable to the garrishly enjoyable.  Make sure to ask for recommendations that go with your food if you need it.

Overall, it is an experience -- a Japanese izakaya that stays true to its identity and soul.

reviews.title: Good place for food and drinks
reviews.text: Been to Nobuya many times, nice place for simple izakaya, if you don’t drink alcohol, then don’t go to this place, simple as that, we definitely had a good time at Nobuya.

reviews.title: heaven for people looking for Tokyo/Osaka under rail viaduct style Izakaya at that price!
reviews.text: This spot is definitely a spot for a casual night out but only for drinkers.  It has array of excellent Japanese Otsumami (tapas), and moreover well selected Sake, mainly of Junmai Ginjyo stock (this does not equate to being the best. As in wine, some people prefer Bourgogne, some haute Medoc, some Cote du Rhone, so goes same for Sake.).  This at an incredibly affordable price for SG.  The staffs are alert, responds quickly, as if this was in Japan.  Probably better than Japan.  There is one catch.  If one is looking for Haute Cuisine under glamorous interior, go another place.  It is dimly lit because the building is old and will not spend an extra cent.  It is clammed. You will get harassed if you are not one of the drink drink and be merry tribe.

reviews.title: Great food and atmosphere.
reviews.text:
People are giving this place poor reviews because they require every patron to order drinks. To me, this isn't a problem, and not a reason to give a place a bad review. Especially since this place is quite well known at this point for having this rule. You shouldn't be surprised, and if it's such a big issue, just don't go.

The food was great. There were four of us and we ordered quite a few dishes. The food was consistently good, and arrived promptly. We enjoyed every single one. Drinks were excellent as well. Atmosphere was fantastic. I seldom go to Izakayas, but a friend who does both in Singapore and Japan tells me this is as close as it gets.

name: Little Singapore By Chef Bernard

reviews.title: Great experience!
reviews.text: amazing food and great service! We had a really big crab that could feed an entire village. The meat was so juicy and tender, really worth it!

reviews.title: The biggest Crab we've ever eaten
reviews.text: The crab was very big, 1.6kg was too much for two people to eat, but the taste was very delicious and different from other crabs I have ever eaten.

reviews.title: First time private lunch
reviews.text: Private and satisfying meals, all 100% made by the Chef. It's fresh and delicate taste, very interesting. You also can talk to the chef other than the food.

reviews.title: Best Kepiting in town
reviews.text: Chef Bernard Bali serves the best crab in Bali! The flavors are incredible, the crab is fresh and perfectly cooked, and the seasoning is just right. The service is top-notch, and the ambiance adds to the experience. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Best Laksa In Bali
reviews.text: My Favorite Laksa in Bali, one year already going for several times to the restaurant and always so tasty, owner so humble and waiters are so helpful and nice. I really recommended

description: A Little Singapore in Bali: Savour Authentic Laksa and Chilli Crab with this Spicy Culinary Little Singapore by Chef Bernard Chew to bring authentic Singaporean favourites to the tables of Bali. Two of the most iconic dishes from the ‘Lion City’ are the Singapore Laksa and Singapore Chilli Crab. Spicy, zesty, rich seafood dishes — though distinct from each other — they are real highlights of Singaporean cuisine. Now they are available in Little Singapore Restaurant Umalas Chef Bernard, a dynamic and enthusiastic character, is the founder of Little Singapore, a Bali-based restaurant which is the melting pot of his inextinguishable passion for food — especially that of his Singaporean heritage.

reviews.title: Great restaurant
reviews.text: The food is excellent.  The burgers are so good and they give huge portions.  The staff are friendly and provided professional top notch service.

reviews.title: Great burger
reviews.text:
No.1 place of Singapore’s burger shop.
I’m a fan of Potetohead burger in Singapore. But Black Tap’s burger is as delicious as that one.

reviews.title: Good
reviews.text: I had my last dinner in Singapore at this place, and it was a great choice! The Caesar salad I had was absolutely delicious, and I also tried a cotton candy shake, which was just as tasty. The portions were quite generous as well. I highly recommend this place!

reviews.title: Excellent Food and Exceptional Service
reviews.text: The combination of excellent food and exceptional service by Jess made our recent visit at Black Tap one to remember. She was friendly and professional, knowledgeable and attentive and it made our dining experience all the more enjoyable. We’ll be back and will look and request for Jess to be our server again.

reviews.title: Best burger ever
reviews.text: Amazing service when we arrived late last night.  The burger was the juiciest and tastiest we have ever eaten. Would highly recommend

address.address_string: 10 Bayfront Avenue Marina Bay Sands, The Shoppes, #01-80, Singapore 018972 Singapore

name: Tower Club Singapore

reviews.title: Unforgettable Evening with everything perfect!
reviews.text: Although we are not members of this club, but we came here for a Bordeaux wine dinner. Love the view and the exquisite food! Of course every dish in the 5-course dinner was perfectly paired with Grand Cru wines! Started with poached veal slices on tuna sauce, followed by a half Boston lobster -divinely cooked! Then an interlude of turkey bolognese shall pasta. Main dish is the pan seared Black Angus beef tenderloin. Perfect dinner ended with a double chocolate brownie! Total cost S$396 for 2.

reviews.title: Good time at Straits Bar
reviews.text: Beautiful scenery, well dressed patrons (I personally dislike restaurants/bar where patrons wear slippers/shorts). Straits Bar’s  food and service was great. Thank you and we will be back soon!

reviews.title: Excellent dinner for wife's B'day!
reviews.text:
It was my wife's birthday and I had an opportunity to dine at the Tower Club. I decided to try the Atlantic, in spite of the mixed reviews. In the end we were very pleased with the night. We ordered 3 set dinners for my wife, my daughter and myself. Only my wife had the paired wine menu. When we arrived we were the only party in the restaurant , and as such had the full attention of the staff. Another party arrived much later but we were the only diners for the evening.
The ambience was excellent, food was excellent, staff was efficient and friendly.
We had one novice staff serving us but was able to carry out his roles with guidance.

The food was the highlight.

We started with bread, which was warm and fluffy.

We were then surprised by an order of,

Hokkaido Scallops, which I assumed came with the set.

It was followed by an Appetizer of

MARINATED FOIE GRAS TERRINE
with Sour Cherry, Green Apple Salad, Raisin Compote
and Orange Sauce, paired with 
Satellite Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc 2019, New Zealand.

Then a Pasta of 
LINGUINE PASTA with Smoked Lobster, Cherry Tomato, Fresh Basil Leaves
and Tangy Tomato Creamed Sauce for myself

and 
RISOTTO
with Mixed Forest Mushroom, Black Truffle Salsa, Kale Leaves,
Puff Wild Rice and Parmesan Cheese Snow

The Main we ordered was

PAN-ROASTED BLACK ANGUS RIB-EYE STEAK
with Banana Shallot, New Potatoes, Baby Carrot, Herb Butter
and Chicken Glazed paired with 
D’Alamei Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon 2018, Chile

For Dessert, we had

WARM & COLD RECONSTRUCTED TIRAMISU
with Coffee Jelly, Coffee Meringue, Kahlua Syrup,
Warm Mascarpone Cream and Iced Coffee Granite

and 

SOUFFLÉ GLACÉ À L’ORANGE
with Grand Marnier Sauce and Mandarin Orange Compote

We were surprised by a complimentary order of

Raspberry Panna Cotta by the Chef, which we enjoyed immensely.

It was a dinner that we did not expect!

We will be back again!

Thank you to Lester and his team, and Allan(?) for their hospitality!

*The photos don't do the food justice. We thoroughly enjoyed our 2 hrs of eating and soaking in the ambience.

reviews.title: Poor hospitality
reviews.text:
My partner and I had a very unpleasant experience at Tower Club.

First of all, we had a booking via Amex which we had re-confirmed just 5 minutes before reaching the venue.

Upon arrival, front desk receptionist Lynda started coldly stating that our booking was not reflected in the system.

At one point, when I wanted to ask her a question, she put her hand up toward me signaling me not to bother her.

After which, when we got to the bar, the staff continued to probe my wife about the reservation in front of our guest.

The issue does not only lie in the utter inefficiency of your staff but also the sheer arrogance in handling guests.

Questioning a patron in front of their guests also simply shows really poor etiquette.

The arrogant attitude is unnecessary and neither does it raise the image of a private club.

Tower Club's GM, Andrew Mah responded to my feedback, and Carol Tan, Member Relations Director, was the liaison for my complaint.

Of which, Carol failed to address the key points of my initial feedback.

And upon my highlighting to them, she responded with a cookie-cutter corporate response.

I have not heard back from them since as I reckon their approach to hospitality is to sweep it under the rug and move on.

If this is the way senior management approaches hospitality, it's no wonder service is below par.

reviews.title: Worth the membership
reviews.text: We had dinner at Ba Xian. Wow the food is great, Peking Duck, Wasabi Mayonaise Prawn and Tofu w Mushrooms were pur favorite. The service was execellent especially by Sean and Shirlyn of Ba Xian and by Cindy the staff at 62nd floor Concierge. The ambience and the view from the restaurant was superb.

description: Enter the heights of unparalleled grandeur, where business and pleasure meet amidst breathtaking views of Singapore's dynamic city skyline. Soaring above the bustling CBD, Tower Club resides in a prime central location, and brings a premier, private setting where the business elite meets, network and entertain.

address_obj.address_string: 9 Raffles Place Republic Plaza Tower 1, Singapore 048619 Singapore

address.address_string: 9 Raffles Place Republic Plaza Tower 1, Singapore 048619 Singapore

name: Potato Head Singapore

reviews.title: Super authentic bar and restaurant in china town with great cocktails
reviews.text: Came back to this place after many years. Was less busy on a Tuesday evening than it used to be but atmosphere at rooftop bar and view were still great and some of the best cocktails in town. Not too sweet, very well balanced drinks.

reviews.title: OVERRATED & OVERPRICED...even for Singapore standards!
reviews.text:
Name has changed to 1939, so we were a little confused until we got there for our reservation. We've been here for 2.5 years so finally went and were very underwhelmed (and sticker shocked)...2 burgers and 3 drinks = $140. I know Singapore is expensive....we live here...but this was something else considering you're not overlooking Marina Bay! 

We were taken to our table and immediately felt like we were being hustled out for faster turnover on the table. When we got our food, we had to FLAG DOWN servers to get anything extra since once you get your order you're ignored. No problem, we just won't return and will not recommend.

reviews.title: Good food, good drinks, good vibes!
reviews.text: After being told there was only standing available, we found ourselves in ‘The Studio’ on Level 2 and was sat down immediately! Food was delicious and cocktails were fantastic. The vibe was so fun, cool and exactly where you want to be on a Friday night.

reviews.title: Well, that was that then!!!!!
reviews.text:
We went just for a quick drink and snack on the rooftop bar to cool down a bit after lots of exploring, having wanted to go on a few past Singapore trips, but it hadn’t worked out.  Really it was just Potato Head’s position on Keong Saik Road in a fabulously attractive and iconic (and much photographed!) heritage building that drew us to it. We hadn’t been particularly concerned about what food it served but we were keen enough to try a few cocktails. 
So after much anticipation we walked out of there a bit like …… ‘well that was that then’!?!? 
There was NO feel good factor at all. The experience was almost singularly let down by the rude and practically mute male waiter who had no interpersonal skills and didn’t react to any thanks, smiles or anything. He said the bare essential words required to do only the minimum that he was being paid to do….and he should take some advice - get out of hospitality!!!
The satays were fine and the cocktail list is quite fun (although you receive those enormous ice ‘slabs’ in your glasses and seemingly next to no liquid!!!!!) but really I wouldn’t tell anyone to bother going to Potato Head…..

reviews.title: David Bromley overload!
reviews.text: There are more David Bromley sculptures, painting and objects here than in one his shops…. Ive never seen so much in one place. As a decorating theme it’s very unique and must have been crazy expensive to buy all of these works, but overall it looks really good and every one I was with commented on how good the venue looked. The food was okay… pretty standard western style pub food for the most part with greasy burgers and lots of sides. I’d recommend it if you’re looking for something casual.

description: Located inside an iconic heritage building in Chinatown, Potato Head Singapore is spread over four floors. This is the first international outpost of Potato Head and is currently home to a branch of Three Buns Burgers & Cocktails, Studio 1939 cocktail bar and one of the most tropical rooftop bars in Singapore.

address_obj.address_string: 36 Keong Saik Road, Singapore 089143 Singapore

ranking_data.ranking_string: #624 of 13,571 Places to Eat in Singapore

address.address_string: 36 Keong Saik Road, Singapore 089143 Singapore

reviews.title: Bad customer service and giving wrong orders
reviews.text: On 10 Mar 2025, I ordered takeaway for 2 pc chicken joy spicy with side. The first round the staff gave me a burger (instead of chicken) and I had to drive all the way back to exchange. However, they gave the wrong items again during the exchange even though I had asked them to open the box and they just said they had given me the spicy chicken.  Similar to feedback by other customers, the staff at waterway really could not be bothered to listen or check the customers' orders.

reviews.title: Very RUDE TUDONG MALAY COUNTER GIRL
reviews.text: The counter staff wearing TUDONG was always very rude to the customers! Asking politely for wing part if possible, if not possible i wont buy. Then she checked at kitchen and took my order, meaning have. Then end up gave me other parts. So i approached her and she grab from me the box and slam inside the bin. I told her its your fault not mine. And i complaint to the dity manager but seems like all the worker here at this JOLLIBEE BEDOK MALL have one attitude in common!!! All very rude and very bad service! Lessons learned… not going to patronize this stupid outlet anymore!!!  Or the whole brand for my peace of mind!!!!  Please do something, not once but always all team was super rude speacially that TUDONG MALAY COUNTER GIRL!!!!

reviews.title: Crispy n hot
reviews.text:
The chicken is hot and crispy.
 And the slaw n sides are pretty good.
Seating aplenty and clean.
The waiting time for the food is a tad on the long side.  Due to its popularity, the staff are busy busy all of the time.  You want good chicken?  What you gonna do.

reviews.title: Poor preparation of takeout meals
reviews.text:
I went today 21 Sept 2024@ 12:58PM to order meals for my family, meals comprising of 
2no. (1) Chicken joy w/ spaghetti , 2 no.(2) pcs.burger steaks w/ rice , 2 no. jolly hotdogs, 2 no.single classic burgers, 4 no. peach mango pies, 1no. tender chicken.
before I leave , I checked some items if there are missing, w/c is there is missing of 2 mango pies , then I asked the person in-charge that there are 2 mango pies missing, so he given me that  and I thought those wrapped papers are burgers , so I went home, then when I reached home those wrapped paper are only rice. W/c means 2 burgers are missing.

 And I called few times . No body answer the phone. These is happened to me few times already. At Lucky plaza (basement shop) and at Woodland branch. 

Hopefully your service will be improve, to avoid this Hustle .

reviews.title: A not so good experience
reviews.text: I went to the Lucky Plaza branch and I'm not happy with my experience. I was carrying a tray in both hands while making my way to a table. At the stairs, there was a trolley, and a man was unloading supplies. I asked him politely if I could pass, but the space was too narrow. Instead of moving the trolley, he said, 'Either you go or I must go.' What happened to Jollibee's standards?

address_obj.address_string: 304 Orchard Road Lucky Plaza 1/f Lucky Plaza, Singapore 238863 Singapore

address.address_string: 304 Orchard Road Lucky Plaza 1/f Lucky Plaza, Singapore 238863 Singapore
